JobTitle: Government Public Services (GPS) Lead GPS Pricing Specialist
JobFullDesc: Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) Practice is currently searching for a Lead Pricing Specialist Are you ready to apply your financial and analytical skills in a dynamic environment? Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to be a strategic business advisor in pursuit of new business opportunities? If so, Deloitte could be the place for you! We are looking for experienced Pricing specialists, Project Controllers or Financial/Business analysts to move into a pricing role in support of large-scale contracts in a fast-paced business climate. If you are seeking a challenging role that promotes personal development and the opportunity to contribute to organizational success, consider a career with the Deloitte GPS Pricing and Estimating Group.Work You'll Do: As a Lead Pricing Specialist on our team, you will report to the Pricing Team Lead to support the pricing of new and existing business opportunities across our Government and Public Services (GPS) Practice. The Lead Pricing Specialist will work with moderate supervision in the execution of the following key responsibilities:Perform proposal preparation, coordinate vendor quotes, and participate in quality assurance reviews with minimal guidance from Team Lead. Perform proposal reviews with management, primarily in a support role.Build and populate templates to facilitate identification and population of staff within the estimating data. Interacting with the Engagement Team, Procurement, and outside sources to collect data for proposals, as applicable.Develop, communicate, and execute pricing and subcontracting strategies within proposals.Develop cost / price exhibits to convey the appropriate information necessary to convey our cost / price data effectively and compliantly.Develop and communicate Pricing's requirements in the proposal planning/ scheduling process. Review proposal with management.Review and interpret RFP/RFQ documentation; identify and develop questions based on the solicitation that impact Pricing compliance and strategy.Coordinate review of the pricing volume with Contracts and other internal groupsLead the Pricing Volume content development and publication prior to submission.Perform job-related duties as assigned.A high degree of collaboration and communication is expected and encouraged for success in this role.The team Transparency, innovation, collaboration, sustainability: these are the characteristic attributes shaping Higher Education as well as Federal, State, and Local government initiatives today. Deloitte's GPS practice is passionate about making an impact with lasting change. Carrying out missions in the GPS practice requires fresh thinking and a creative approach. We collaborate with teams from across our organization to bring the full breadth of Deloitte - commercial, Federal, and public-sector expertise - to best support our GPS clients. Our aspiration is to be the premier integrated solutions provider in helping to transform the Public Services marketplace.The GPS Enabling Areas team provides specialized support such as proposal pricing to Deloitte's internal business units by developing new products and services to sustain our competitive advantage, while consistently improving our existing collection of systems, processes, and functions.QualificationsRequired:Minimum 5 years in professional service in one of the following disciplines (or combination thereof) pricing, program control, financial analysis, market research, or consulting, focused on providing business strategies, competitive intelligence, or market research within the Federal or State/Local/Higher Education marketplace;At least 3 years analytical experience (interpretation of data and reporting results);Minimum of 3 years' experience in the use of Microsoft Office Applications with a strong focus on Excel modeling for analysis and data presentation, and PowerPoint for developing effective presentations;Undergraduate degree is required, preferably in Accounting, Finance, or Business.Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.Preferred:Knowledge of the proposal life cycle as well as contract types, including fixed-price, cost, T&M/FPLH, GSA Schedules, BPA/IDIQs; Commercial and State & Local a plusUnderstanding solicitation pricing requirements and evaluation criteriaConcepts of Cost vs. Price and Direct vs. Indirect rate structuresAbility to accurately develop and maintain pricing models, summarize data and perform peer validation / auditing functionsGeneral knowledge of Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) and other contractual regulations relating to proposal pricing a plusAbility to identify many commonly used regulations and explain their relevancy to bids and pricing in general.The ideal candidate will have analytical skills, attention to detail, be creative and inquisitive, and be able to be equally successful working independently and within a team. The candidate should have good organizational skills specifically around the management, analysis, and processing of large amounts of data to arrive at required outputs. As such, analytical skills and the general ability to use standard tools such as MS Excel, MS Access, PowerPoint and Word are necessary. The candidate should also have excellent communication skills - specifically the ability to communicate complicated pricing and procurement concepts to others that may have less expertise in the subject area.
